title: Basic
text:
This system is really very basic for what it should be able to do.

1. More intuitive interface, think google maps not Apple reminders.
2. Longer dimming up to an hour at least.
3. Change controls based on seasonal changes in ambient light 
3b. Also, if you really invest I should be able to get a sensor or location based ambient light information that helps judge how I want to control my lights.
4. Vacation mode which allows you to have “temporary disabling of a scene”
5. HomeKit, you really missed the ball here... get this working without a new hub or new switches.

You could do so much with this. Just invest in it.

title: Botched cloud transition- a platform with an unclear future
text:
The new Legrand cloud service has broken nearly everything. While the app was never very good, it could at least find the controller fairly reliably. Now with the 4.0 update the app rarely finds the controller locally, and remote access works 20% of the time. Often devices show up double, and nothing works. But the benefit if the system has been the ability to use physical scene keypads. This way I could eliminate the stupid app altogether. But now the LC7001 controller locks up about every 72 hours, and becomes unresponsive to keypad presses. 

I have to wonder what the future holds for this platform. Legrand themselves have released direct WiFi switches, essentially stating that the RF technology is on its way out. I don’t like WiFi switches for many reasons but they are newer than these switches that haven’t changed much since 2005 when Miro was introduced. 

Please fix these issues. I will give up remote access if it means that my expensive system isn’t worthless. Lutron RadioRA2 is sounding really good right now...

title: No Apple HomeKit Integration?
text:
The app is pretty basic. Nothing special. It would be better if you could circumvent having to launch the app altogether and have proper iOS integration with HomeKit, Siri and Siri Shortcuts. Without these integrations the app falls well short. When will these integrations happen ?

Update: 
down rating to one star after developer response. My ask is when will the line of products that use THIS app get Siri / HomeKit integration. Telling me about another app that uses another line of products that has Siri / HomeKit integration is of zero help. Is Legrand expecting folks to rip out their expensive adorn true touch light switches from their walls and replace with another line of products just to get siri / HomeKit integration ????? This is BS. All Legrand needs to do is come out with a new Base control box that can connect to existing products and support Siri / HomeKit and update the app. It’s not rocket science ....

title: New Cloud Service Configuration
text: I love the Legrand controller and IOS Application. It’s true they could have done a better job with the cloud rollout. I tried for weeks to get the new cloud configuration working. Is was not going to happen from the IOS application. I finally emailed the configuration link to my desktop and used Crome explorer to configure cloud service. By my surprise it worked. Just don’t forget to release the old service from your IOS application first. I’m a system analyst by trade, so I guess I had an small advantage .  I would never go to the cloud service only. My WiFi is spotty and would surly have trouble with reliability!

title: Aesthetically pleasing, technically disappointing
text:
I am a 25 year electrical veteran.
I work for a top 50 electrical contractor in the nation. In all my years wiring commercial facilities. I have never dealt with such a poor hi-tech product. Not been more displeased with a product.
I purchased this product for the plates which are indeed beautiful. I have installed many Legrand products in my career.
Ever since they updated the app in an attempt to make the remote control feature work the local control feature does not work.
The fundamental things this Product should do is primarily turn lighting on and off. Secondly it should do this via an app. Thirdly it should not break down over time.
The first item had been perfected for nearly 70 years. We can buy $.69 devices to do this. 
The second item is a luxury and thus why we paid the premium to purchase this product.
This product fails on such a secular level at this it is almost criminal fraud to advertise that this device can perform this function.
However it looks nice.
It is highly overpriced for what it can do. Be warned if you are reading this, then it is because you are entertaining app controlled lighting. In this case move on in your quest as this platform cannot do it.

title: Beautiful smart switches
text: I bought the system before it went online. I have 22 dimmers that are smart switches and my outlets as well as a few non smart switches were also installed. I’m out of the country part of the year, but you would never know it. I have 8 scenes set that remain constant and while I’m away I play with changes to the lighting remotely. I had a couple of problems honestly, but the customer service group took care of me quickly and all was resolved. I love the way it works and how beautiful it looks in my home.

title: Rethink Buying these Switches Because You Can’t Use This App
text: I really loved the idea of being able to automate my lights but the software (this app) is terrible. I can never log in and if I’m lucky (it seems random) it’ll be able to find my system and I can control the lights. I have been able to at least set it to timers and then just forget about using the app but every now and then the app seems the crap out and the lights don’t turn on/off when I set them to... then getting back on the app involves unplugging the controller and just hoping the app recognizes the system. It seems this problems have been more frequent with this cloud integration. Great idea but poorly executed. I love the switches but the system in total is not worth the hassle in my opinion.

title: Wont recognize any but one switch in the house
text: It has been relatively simple to install (with the caveat that the ethernet cable to the controller should be on the same home network as the phone with the app). However, the process to add lights has been successful only on one of the 5 smart switches we bought. This is a new house with new wiring all around. The app does work to control the one switch that was recognized as soon as I tapped it. For other switches, no such luck. The app does not recognize. I have great wifi signal through the entire house. The house is modest size (one of the switches that did not get recognized and added is in the same room as the controller and has direct line of site). The one that did get recognized and added is farther away.

title: With the new update working well
text: Either the latest update I am very happy with the system. I can update scenes with my phone and the inwall scene controllers work very well. Need to finish installing a few switches and finalize my Alexa integration. Wish it worked with Apple HomeKit but that’s more on Apple than Legrand. Had app issues when it was first released but is now a more mature and useful app. BTW I have contacted tech support both during switch installation on the phone and for software issues via email and I received good, fast support.

title: Terrible performance for one of the most expensive light switches on the market
text: Paying a premium price for Legrand Adorne WiFi switches- I’d expect much more reliable performance. It’s more trouble than it’s worth to keep trying to figure out why the app isn’t controlling the light switch command. It seems to be an issue with their cloud. Every time the app is not communicating with the switch- I noticed the app has kicked me out of the cloud (every other time I boot it up) and I have to log back in- which is very frustrating. This should be auto saved! How about investing some of those profits into an app that actually works. How about listening to these other reviewers too!

title: Unstable app - and still a problem after the latest update
text:
First and foremost, the Product team should really assess their developers and see if they’re capable of performing their jobs. Customers are paying a lot of money for these switches and should be able to have a smooth running app that goes along with them. Revamp your team.

Again, nothing has changed since my last review, which was months ago, and even with the latest update this week. It continually asks me to log in, access my lights remotely, and can’t set timers. 

Lighting automation shouldn't be this unstable especially when paying premium for light switches. The app is continually discovering my system which cannot find.

title: Just doesn’t work at all
text:
I sign in to remote access repeatedly, which sends you back to the app—and nothing happens. Meanwhile, even within my network, it’s clear the switches are connected (the app updates immediately when they’ve been physically pressed) and yet it almost never does anything when you do it from the app, e.g. turn a light on or off, change the dimmer level etc. 

Why oh why does Legrand use a proprietary interface rather than Wink or something that might actually work and be convenient?! Anti-consumer nonsense.

title: The LC7001 will never have HomeKit compatibility
text: Just called tech support.  Unfortunately my high end light fixture only works with Legrand controllers.  The LC7001 specifically. I’m 100% Apple.  They confirmed it will never have HomeKit compatibility as it doesn’t have the hardware inside to work so no upgrade is coming.  Don’t know why you would choose this when I can get even get a single Hue bulb / hub to work. Why wouldn’t you at least build that in hardware into a Oct 2017 controller? Ugh. I hope at least the Alexa integration will work. :/

title: Really awful
text: The switches look great, and if one didn’t want anything beyond that, I’d recommend them. But, as most other people have stated, the app and the integration into a smart home is atrocious. The app takes so long to “discover” the system, and then often it doesn’t. The app is so basic as to be laughable in this day and age. I have spent a lot of money on these switches, but finally biting the bullet and ripping them all out and replacing with Lutron.

title: Updated
text: I just downloaded the app and I see that the upgrades are amazing and I am having fun updating zones in my home.   What else I think is amazing is the fact that any firmware updates will be done over the internet.

title: Don’t buy!!!
text:
I believed the reviews that said the prior issues with the connectivity to the mandatory (!!) were resolved but that is not true. 80% of time unable to connect to the LC7001 hub which is the only way to control the switches remotely. So 80% of the time these switches are NOT able to be remotely controlled. Will seek refund and go through the work to remove. Buyer beware - read (and believe) the bad reviews. 

Absolute waste of money.

Do NOT buy Le Grand.

title: Barely Smart
text:
Stay away if you are looking for an intuitive, reliable, and feature rich smart home app.

The only reason why I’m using this system is because the Legrand Adorne line looks great, and the app manages to turn things on and off on a schedule.

One thing I would recommend is to assign a static IP to the Legrand Smart Hub so that you have less problems connecting to it.

I hope Legrand gets serious and invest in their smart home system to make it competitive with many other brands.

Previous Review- 
I loved the idea and look of the Adorne.

However, Back in November of 16 several in tech support told me they'd have remote access before end of year, so invested in Legrand.  It's now May and nothing.

For the superior cost, we definitely are NOT getting a superior product, yet.   I hold out hope they will have the remote access on the app soon and I can also return and exchange my switches.  

5 stars if everything gets working.

title: Zero stars for app AND hardware
text: Spent a lot of money during a whole house remodel in 2018 to change to Legrand RF switches. What a waste of money. The only positive comment I have is that the switches themselves look great. Other than that here are the things that aren’t great… - Three way switches keep losing their “pairing” to each other. So sometimes the paired switch is essentially dead. Which then causes all the lights on that circuit to not respond to the app on my phone or in wall scene controllers. Seems to happens randomly. - App is glitchy. Sometimes the app shows specific lights are off when they are on and vice versa. Must repeatedly tap the on off “slider” on the app for each switch to “wake up” the switches. - App has trouble connecting to the hub. Cue the spinning wheel of death! This is not an issue with my phone or WiFi. I have no trouble connecting to my Lutron hub (I have since started using Lutron Caseta plugs for table lamps and LOVE the Lutron product) - In wall scene controller or a scene from app must be activated repeatedly to set all of the lights on a scene. Lights are set in a random order EVERY TIME and I never know which light is going to be skipped by a controller so I have to go room to room to make sure each light was set properly defeating the purpose of a one touch programmed scene! - Hub must often be rebooted to get anything to work from app and/or scene controller (requires unplugging or inserting a pin into a tiny hole in back of a device that is hidden in a cabinet with other equipment). What a pain! I’m tired of being a contortionist to get my overpriced lighting system to work. This app seemed to get more glitchy when Legrand shifted away from Artik cloud to their own Eliot cloud remote access system. (I spent hours on the phone with technical support trying to figure out how to get my programming from artik to Eliot to no avail.) I’ve kept the app updated and routinely reboot WiFi and my phone and I do not have issues with any of my other smart home equipment or interfaces. Seems like Legrand engineering missed the boat and left all of its customers standing on the dock with them. Next project I’m going with Lutron. Legrand it would be nice if you helped my existing switches be more than just nice looking wall decor. Right now they are pretty dumb. Nothing smart about them.

title: A lot of promise, a little buggy
text:
We installed the adorne switches through a large part of our house during a remodel. I was excited to see the new lighting controller and associated app, and added it a couple weeks ago. The app works well to control lighting in the house, and the scene setup is pretty easy. 

I was hoping to see the "record" feature of the older, more expensive controller. It's also important to note that you can't control a house unless you're on that wifi (like to check it on vacation). There also doesn't seem to be an easy was to turn automated scenes on/off from the scene page. 

I've been a little disappointed in the reliability of the sunset/sunrise automation of certain lights. After returning from a short trip, our outside lights were on, despite supposed to being turned off 5 hours earlier when the sun rose. Since then, the same automated scenes don't always appear in the "upcoming scene" list. I have to edit the scene and re-saved it to make them appear in the list. Even after that, the light hasn't turned on/off when it was supposed to, twice. 

Hopefully legrand updates the controller and/or app soon to address this and maybe add some usability features.

title: Has potential

title: Some improvements but still woefully behind the times
text:
Updated for Version 2
What were they thinking!? Why in the world would they use Samsung Artik. And why do I have to recreate all 60 of my lights and all 16 of my scenes, and have to be at the house to do it. What a waste of hours of my time. Why not just work with Nest, Harmony Hub, HomeKit, SmartThings or other standards. Or if you're going to just build remote control directly, why not do it as simply as Hue or the 9 other smart home apps I use for other equipment... set up once and you're done. Whether you're at home on wifi or away over mobile, it auto detects and just works.

Cons:
